event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_NOTHING
event.text: Tully appears to be waiting in his cabin. "Sorry, don't have much to talk about. Maybe check in with some of the other crew?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_GENERIC_1
event.text: You find Tully polishing his blaster, whistling some song you've never heard before. "This? Oh, this is an old marching song back from the Federation-Mantis War. Of all the things that've stuck with me the most, it's funny to think it's the music. I guess the rest you just don't really want to remember, you know?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_GENERIC_2
event.text: You ask Tully if he has any lasting grudges on the Mantis after the Federation-Mantis. "The Mantis? Certainly not. My life was saved by a group of Mantis. The Hive's another story. But if you let yourself blame the wrong people for too long, you'll fall victim to your own spite. Just look at Vance - I can't ever let myself end up like him."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_GENERIC_3
event.text: "Funny thing, did you know Vance hates his last name? He told me that once: his parents weren't great people. Not that it's any excuse how he ended up, but you know. That's why they call him Admiral Vance, not Admiral Wentworth. Poor kid got mocked so hard during training, calling him 'Wentworthless'. Well, I don't envy those people now."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_GENERIC_4
event.text: Tully walks past you in the hallway, and you give him a cursory nod. Tully blinks, scowls, and continues to walk away before he stops again.

"Oh, uh... sorry Captain, it's nothing. I'm just used to being the one in command. If any of my officers pass by and don't salute me, I make them drop and give me 50. I don't suppose it's appropriate to do that here, though."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_GENERIC_5
event.text:
You notice a collection of movies on the table in Tully's room. All of them seem to be on similar material - Federation wars. The Federation-Mantis War, the Inquisitions, the Civil War, and a couple smaller ones you aren't too familiar with. Tully spots you looking at them and says, "I've started collecting documentaries on the wars I've lived through out of curiosity. You'd be amazed how wildly inaccurate some of them can be."
Tully picks up a rather provocatively titled one called 'The Red Menace: Earth's Last Stand'. "I mean seriously, this one uses footage of Coalition Bombers when the Coalition didn't form until after the Civil War! And it claims the Mantis were using clone armies! Cloning technology wasn't invented until several decades later, and it was by the Shells! There has never been a clone army deployed in all of our known galactic history!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_FREDDY_1
event.text: You find Tully and Freddy chatting together idly, reminiscing about the Federation-Mantis War. "You know, I met a young Free Mantis during the war after I escaped from captivity. Funny thing is, I gave him a nickname. Freddy. Ain't that such a coincidence?" Freddy nods his head. "Oh, ain't that swell! What a coincidence indeed. You ever met him again after you were rescued by the Feds?" Tully shakes his head and Freddy frowns. "Oh, well that's just a shame. Maybe some day you'll meet him again?" Tully shrugs. "Maybe some day, just maybe..." Both wave to each other and walk away. You aren't sure if you should say something.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_FREDDY_2
event.text: Freddy appears to be teaching Tully about Mantis dialect. To his surprise, Tully already knows most of it. "Well well, you never fail to impress me, Admiral! You speak near perfect Yeitiiik! Better than even my contemporaries!" Tully smiles but doesn't accept the compliment. "Oh, I was taught by a Mantis and I just kept practicing. Comes in use for diplomacy sometimes. It was also just funny to spook Turzil sometimes."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_TURZIL_1
event.text:
You spot Tully walking over to Turzil and staring at his arm plate. "Turzil, I've got to ask. Where'd the yellow come from? I swear the last time we spoke you were grey!"
"-Blushing-. Please, do [not] inquire. It is... embarrassing. But... does it look bad? Perhaps I should remove it. Yes, I will do so."
Tully realizes his error and puts his palms on Turzil's shoulders. "No no, I didn't mean like that! It suits you, buddy! Some time you gotta teach me how to paint, alright?"
Turzil seems to shrink a bit. "Y-you want me to -teach- you how to paint? Together? Privately?"
Tully nods but seems a bit unsure. "Yeah? Not sure why you say it so weirdly... but yeah! But not now, we've got more important things to do."
"Yes. -Yes-. Of course. More important things. Of course..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_TURZIL_2
event.text: You poke your head into Tully's quarters for a moment only to find Turzil in there instead, staring blankly at the wall. You think he's shorted out, but he turns around startled like he's been caught. In his hand is one of Tully's hats, which he throws on the shelf and goes running out past you. You decide to say nothing about it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_ALKRAM_1
event.text: You flick on the cameras to view the other ships and see what the crew are doing. You watch in the kitchen as Tully walks in to grab some food, followed several minutes later by Alkram. Both pause when they see each other, and Tully's hand inches closer to his rifle. The cameras experience some interference as Alkram begins to build a slow electric charge. The two stare at each other, both ready to draw, frozen in place. The standstill finally comes to an end when the microwave beeps, signifying Tully's pasta meal is ready. He sighs and abandons his gun, and Alkram calms down as well. Though no words are ever exchanged, they share a nod of mutual agreement and sit at opposite tables to eat.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TULLY_DEVORAK_1
event.text:
Devorak and Tully both cross paths in the hallways, and almost immediately Devorak starts to reach for his sword. Stretching his fingers, he begins to slide it out of his holster. Tully's eyes slant and he slides his hand towards his blaster.
"Devorak." "Tully?" "Put the sword down." "The sword?" "Yes, the sword." Devorak blinks. "Oh, right. Sorry, sorry! I didn't meant to put you on edge! It all must be very confusing, but you must understand I am the sword!" "You're... what?" "I'm the sword!" "Okay... cool I guess? I can't say I understand, but it's good to see you again. I saw your speech. I don't know if the Federation would be inclined to forgive you for betraying them initially, but I for one am glad to have you back."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_NOTHING
event.text: You find Haynes pacing the hallways, talking to himself and looking at the floor. When he sees you, he pauses momentarily. "Sorry, lost in thought. Maybe go talk to someone else right now, I'm mulling things over. Detective stuff, and all that."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_1
event.text: "No offense, but I've never really liked the label 'Renegade'. People seem to slap it on anyone who travels between realities nowadays that isn't a Rebel, but it carries a certain stigma. I've never really been the mercenary type."

choice.text: Doesn't working for us make you a Renegade now?

event.text: "I... I suppose it does. Fair point. I have been... humbled?" Haynes temporarily removes his pipe from his mouth. "Grrr, I guess I'm a murder hobo now. I kill babies. Or something. But uh... please try to refrain from warcrimes while I'm onboard. I get that you can get away with a lot in this profession, but I'd at least like to be able to sleep at night after this."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_2
event.text: Before he started traveling the Multiverse himself, Haynes used to live on Earth. However, he had to leave his home behind when Archive Inc. could no longer hold back the Vek threat. It's quite the sad story, and his isn't the only one like it out there.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_3
event.text: "My parents were huge history buffs. Everyone who lived in Archive was. Makes sense, it's even in the name. There's some famous runes about a guy named Sherlock Holmes who lived in the ancient empire of Britannia who could solve any mystery. My mother loved to read the legends, and though she didn't believe Sherlock was real, she jumped at the chance to name her son after him. That son being me, of course. No siblings. There can only be one 'greatest detective'."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_4
event.text: You ask Haynes if he smokes or not, since you never seem to smell it. He looks surprised at the notion and removes his pipe from his mouth. "What? Oh, of course not. Great deductive skills though! No no, tobacco's quite rare now that Earth's flooded and the drug market's saturated with all kinds of Slug junk. The pipe was a gift from my grandfather, who got it from his grandfather, who got it from his... and so on. They say it belonged to a guy named... er... Star-line? Stelen? Oh, father would be so disappointed in me for forgetting. Either way, it's a precious heirloom. I hate to admit it, but it's kind of fun chewing on the end. Clearly grandfather agrees, because there were toothmarks even before my own."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_5
event.text: You overhear some screaming from somewhere else on the ship and race towards it. Expecting intruders of some sort of worse, someone's fingers falling off from another space plague, instead you find Haynes screaming like a child in a corner of the ship as a tiny arachnid scuttles around on the floor. Carefully, he draws his firearm and aims it at the bug, blasting it to smithereens. Only after it's dead does he see you watching him, and meagerly slinks away in shame.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_6
event.text: You find Haynes contemplating something in his quarters. "There was a time I might have considered myself a patriot. Now, I'm not capitalist nor a warm-blooded Unionite, but I was proud of, if nothing else, the raw achievement and progress the Human race was able to accomplish against all the odds. Most species have some access to Aether or were from a time when Aether was still being made, but Humans? We paved our way all on our own. And we used to be grateful to be a part of the galaxy! The Engi, the Zoltans, they were our friends! We fought arm in arm against the Hive, but that BASTARD Vance had to change everything! And his cohorts, Tanaka and Stimly, god what I wouldn't give to be the one to put lead in all three of their skulls. I doubt anyone needs to tell you this, but the Rebellion is the scourge of the galaxy; I can only hope the Union will some day get past this and we can all see the Rebellion for what it really is. It's not a glorious movement of human progress - it threatens to set the whole damn Multiverse back to the metaphorical stone age."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_7
event.text: "You ever wonder what becomes of the people in the cases you solve? Well, I guess you wouldn't. But as a detective, I can't help but think about it. I think about it a lot, actually. Poor Amy and Daniel, not only did they have to deal with the death of their coworker and the arrest of another, but the twist they were working with two spies at once." Haynes sits down in a nearby chair and pulls out his pipe and goes to light it, only to remember he doesn't smoke. "God. Maybe I'm just stupid, you know? Even the greatest detective in the Multiverse can be an idiot sometimes. Worrying about nonsense like this when so much more is at stake."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_8
event.text: As you approach, Haynes smoothens out his jacket and straightens his hat. "You know, it's the outfit that makes the man!" He contemplates that piece of wisdom for a moment, shrugs, and walks off.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_9
event.text: You find Haynes reading a book titled "A Study in Scarlet", which he closes when he spots you. "Ever wonder why it is people call me by my last name? I mean, I'm literally named after a legendary icon of Old Earth culture and yet everyone just calls me Haynes! It drove my mother to the brink of madness, but I always found it humorous. Oh well."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_GENERIC_10
event.text: You spot Haynes doing some trick shots for the other crew with his pistol. He's a pretty good shot, but those bullets have to go somewhere - and you don't like the number of holes you've been noticing around the ship lately. You make a mental note to talk to him about it, but not right now. Never discipline a crewmate while they're holding a gun, even if they're usually well-mannered like Haynes.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_FREDDY_1
event.text:
Upon spotting Haynes, Freddy rushes over before Haynes can shut the door on him. "Greetings Mister Haynes! Do pardon me for the intrusion, but I have an inquiry and I believe you're the right person to ask."
Halfway hidden behind his door and quivering slightly, Haynes asks what 'inquiring' Freddy is refering to. "Ah yes, well, I was wondering how much you knew about what I believe is the mythological empire of Britannia. Is it true they were said to wear hats like mine, and had delightfully posh accents?"
Haynes seems confused. "Well, for one, Britannia was real. It's not a myth. As for the hats, I couldn't tell you. The only surviving photographs are during some ancient wars, nothing of regular day attire. Is that everything?"
Freddy nods, disappointed. "Good. Okay, bye." Before Freddy can even respond, Haynes has already slammed the door shut.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_FREDDY_2
event.text: As you step out into the hallway you watch Haynes rush past, not even saying a word to you. He closes the door behind him and vanishes into the next room, and moments later Freddy walks in. "Captain! How delightful to see you. I don't mean to interupt whatever it is you're doing, but have you happened to seen Haynes? I had some questions on Old Earth history but he said he had to use the restroom and dashed off!"

choice.text: Lie and say you haven't seen Haynes.

event.text: You shrug and apologize, telling Freddy you haven't seen Haynes anywhere. "Ah, real shame. I wished to learn all he had to teach on the history of tea! Oh such a delightful drink it is, of all the marvels ever shared between species I think none can compare."

"Oh thank you Captain! Well, off I go!" Freddy dashes off down the hallway. You carry on with your business, uncertain what to think about the occasional shrieks of fear and slamming doors you can hear on the other end of the ship.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_HAYNES_KAZ_1
event.text:
You've started noticing wherever Kaz goes on the ship, Haynes will always go somewhere else. Kaz clearly has noticed too, because you find him speaking to Haynes in the kitchen. "Have I insulting you in some way? Kaz break many hearts back at home and perhaps leave some orphans during the war, but Kaz never crossing paths with you or Haynes clan. You are too young to have fought in war and I not kill many Humans anyways. So, what is problem with Kaz? Why are you fearing me?" Haynes remains silent and meager, unlike his usual self.
Kaz grows more and more impatient at the silence, finally snapping. "ANSWER ME FLESHBAG! ANSWER KAZAAAKPLETHKILIK OR I WILL MAKE IT PERSONAL VENTURE TO SLEEP WITH EVERY WOMAN OR MAN YOU EVER LOVING! Erm... many apologies. I am working on temper. But please, answering me. If you are hating me at least say why! I am stubborn as all Mantis are, but that is not meaning I cannot improve. We are on same team, no?"

choice.text: Encourage Haynes to talk to Kaz.

event.text:
Haynes gulps but finally speaks up. "It's just... it's nothing to do with you, Kazekpik... Kak... uhm... what's your name again? Sorry."
Kaz laughs a little and tells Haynes to just call him 'Kaz'. "Kaz. Right. It's nothing to do with you. Back on Earth, there were these giant creatures called the Vek. They were insect-like and whenever I see a Mantis I just... it just brings back memories. I prefer not to talk about it."
Kaz nods. "Ah. My sincerest apologizing. You might finding this strange, but once time long ago Kaz winds up on Earth in pod, and recruited into mech squad to fight Vek! Very fun, but mech pilot not life for Kaz. Once I was getting money to buy shuttle off-world I said goodbye, but from that experience I cannot blaming you! Vek very scary indeed! It is okay, Kaz will not bothering you. But if you ever need buddy to blowing up giant insects with, I will gladly join!"

Kaz notices you entered the room for the first time since the conversation started and nods in your direction. "Yes, yes. I give deepest apologies. Not wanting to hurt Haynes' feelings, just wanting to know answers." Kaz wanders away, and Haynes mouths a silent thank you in your direction before grabbing his food and hurrying back to his quarters.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_NOTHING
event.text: You find Jerry standing by one of the rear windows, staring intently out in the abyss beyond. "Oh, hi Captain. I'm okay right now. Maybe go check on the other crew?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_1
event.text: Jerry comes stumbling out of his room, an odd moment in which he isn't wearing his glasses and his hair is even more of a mess, and approaches you. "Captain, I think there's something wrong with the ship's water supply! Someone might have poisoned it! We need to warn everyone immediately!"
"The water tastes... well it HAS taste! Water isn't supposed to taste like anything! I'm not quite sure what p-poison tastes like, but what else could it be?"

choice.text: Only extra filtered water has no taste.

event.text:
"You mean - the water on this ship isn't filtered?! Good god, no wonder uncle said space was dangerous! You must have so many diseases! Captain, we need to fix this!" You assure Jerry that your ship's water is normal and probably doesn't carry any diseases.
"Really? In the Protectorate our water never tasted like anything! Wow... space is so mysterious!"

choice.text: Oh good god it's been poisoned!!!

event.text: Deciding to mess with Jerry, you flick the emergency switch and order all of the crew to line up in the break room. Once they have gathered, you remind everyone that water does, in fact, usually have taste, and SHOULD have taste.

choice.text: It's fine Jerry, go back to sleep.

event.text: "A-are you sure Captain? I'm not joking, there's something wrong!" You assure Jerry there's nothing wrong and urge him to go back to his quarters. Jerry stumbles off, still alarmed.

"Captain please, please! Why aren't you responding?! There's poison in the water!" Jerry starts to cry, pulling on you and trying to get a response. You say nothing, doing your best to act like a statue. Eventually Jerry gets so exhausted he passes out, and you can't help but feel this was a bit unnecessary and cruel.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_2
event.text: Jerry asks you if the ship has any nightlights. You figure Jerry's asking for himself and apologize, but instead he seems concerned for someone else.

Jerry motions for you to follow and leads you to a small crack in the ship where a little plant is growing. "Plants need light to survive, right? I'm worried he'll die here if he stays out of the light too long." You're amazed Jerry cares this much about an inconsequential plant, but you assure him you'll get something figured out for it.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_3
event.text:
You notice an Equinoid plushie in the back of Jerry's quarters and decide to ask him about it. "Oh, well I got that a long time ago when I was just a little kid! My uh... my mother... she always said I got my love of Equinoids from my father. Not that I ever really knew him, but you know. When I was young I used to watch the 'Ellie the Equinoid' show almost daily! Man, the guy who played Ellie sure was dedicated to his role. Oh! And for my 7th birthday, Vance had some guy dress up as Ellie and come to my birthday party! Though, Vance never liked Ellie... or Equinoids. As a kid I never really got it, but now I feel like it was some weird personal grudge."
Jerry shrugs. "Either way, that plushie is old. I've had it since before I was even in Vance's custody. I had a blowout with my uncle one time when I refused to kill some Equinoids on a hunting trip, and he was... well he was pretty mad. I was so scared I hid all of my Ellie stuff under the floorboards so he couldn't take it away! Not that I think he ever would have. For as much as he hated Ellie, he loved me more..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_4
event.text: "It was always uncanny, everywhere I went in the Protectorate people would follow me. If I was ever in front of a crowd, no matter what I said they'd always cheer for me. People would come up to me in the streets and push past my guards, just for a chance to shake my hand or ask me something. There was one girl who kept at it though: I couldn't tell if she was a stalker or... I don't know. I can't really remember her name but I think it started with an 'L'? I thought she was just some soldier, but Sebastian said apparently her father's rich. Like, really rich. I kind of miss all that praise though... but uh, well it was never really earned. I don't want to be cheered on for things my uncle did, good or bad. I want to be cheered for things I've done. Maybe some day I'll be more than just the Admiral's nephew..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_5
event.text: "I've been to Universe 1 a couple times. Never longer than a week, and the tour was kept pretty tightly bound. It's... it's..." Jerry seems at a loss for words. "It's very... industrial. It didn't feel like a place people lived in. Yet, they do. Trillions. A whole galaxy's worth of humans. Everywhere was either too pristine to the point of sterile, or was some automated death machine factory. Safe to say, I didn't like it there. The Rebellion has changed. I was too young to really remember the original civil war, but it couldn't possibly have been like this? Who would have supported it? Who DOES support it?"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_6
event.text: "Captain, do you mind if I ask a question? About the Federation?" Jerry rubs his arm uncomfortably.

"Okay... uhm... why does the Federation have Engi in it? My uncle told me the Engi don't even understand the concept of democracy, or civil rights, or... anything the Federation seems to stand for! The Engi remind me of the Rebellion... one species, totalitarian, and terribly unimaginative outside of creating new death machines. Why would you allow them into the Federation?"

choice.text: The Federation stands for peace, not democracy.

event.text: "So... so if the Rebellion was willing to talk peace, and to stop fighting, you'd let them into the Federation? And the Hive, and the Theocracy, and everyone else? The Federation banished the Slugs once, surely they can do it again with the Engi!" Jerry seems genuinely confused but doesn't want to risk asking more questions right now. He wanders off instead to ponder the situation.

"My uncle says it's because the Federation is too afraid to get rid of them. Then the Federation must be pretty weak... My uncle says the Engi are too weak to be soldiers, so the Federation's engineer force is comprised almost entirely of them instead. If the Engi don't even fight for the Federation, how can you trust them?" Jerry seems genuinely confused, and totally oblivious to the influences of his uncle playing over him. At least you can tell he means it all in innocent earnesty, but for his sake he better shake these views soon.

"So... so the only reason the Harmony is in the Federation is because you're too afraid to get rid of them? Then the Federation must be pretty weak... My uncle says the Engi are too weak to be soldiers, so the Federation's engineer force is comprised almost entirely of them instead. If the Engi don't even fight for the Federation, how can you trust them?" Jerry seems genuinely confused, and totally oblivious to the influences of his uncle playing over him. At least you can tell he means it all in innocent earnesty, but for his sake he better shake these views soon.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_GENERIC_7
event.text:
"Uncle always told me my father was a deadbeat and a smoker. My mother... when she was alive, didn't talk much about him. I don't think I even know his name. I wonder if he loved me. Vance told me he didn't. He couldn't have, with how he treated our family. Family is the most important thing of course. Vance said I should be proud to be a Wentworth, and not a... whatever my father's name was. When my mother divorced him, she changed her name back to Wentworth."
Jerry seems to realize he's been rambling about himself for a bit and stops. "Do you have any family, Captain?"

"Oh, right, you're from U0. It must be so strange there. I hear very mixed descriptions of that place, no one can seem to quite agree what it's like. At least, not in the Rebel circles. In the Protectorate, people seem to think it must be identical to Universe 1, but having seen U1... I would be shocked if that was the case. At the very least there'd have to be more than just humans everywhere! Well uhm... I hope we all make it through this Captain, and you can go see your family again! I don't really have any family anymore... but I guess I'll have to make do."

"Oh... Well, my uncle always told me family is what makes civilized creatures strong. It keeps us organized and together, away from violence. That's why the Mantis are so violent, they don't have proper family structures!"
Jerry blinks. "Sorry that sounds... sounds like something my uncle would say. Vance always had a lot of ideas, and he always wanted to make sure everyone understood them. Myself especially. I guess those things really stick with you."

Jerry seems shocked by this notion. "Nothing?! But... that's not what Vance told me. Family is what makes civilized creatures strong. Keeps them organized and together, and away from violence. That's why the Mantis are so violent, they don't have proper family structures!"
Jerry blinks. "Sorry that sounds... sounds like something my uncle would say. Vance always had a lot of ideas, and he always wanted to make sure everyone understood them. Myself especially. I guess those things really stick with you."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_NIGHTS_1
event.text:
Nights stumbles into the cafeteria, bottle in hand, smiling wide and smugly. This isn't the first time it's happened - he does this whenever he's come up with some new brilliant joke. Everyone turns to look at him, except Jerry who's engrossed in a book he's reading.
"E-Everyone! *hiccup* In honor of the good Rebel Admiral, I've written him a poem!" Nights clears his throat and pretends to read from a scroll. "There once wassss an Admiral Vance, who took a career-changing chance! Fought the hive in a war, and they made him quite sssore, and now nothing remainsss in hisss pance!"
Everyone in the room groans, and Jerry winces. Nights seems to accept this as a call for more and slides up to Jerry. "Hey kid, do you know what a pen isss?" Jerry, utterly confused and very uncomfortable, nods his head. "Uh... yes?"
Nights spreads his arms wide and exclaims "Well hey, at leasssst *hiccup* one Wentworth doessss! HAHAHAHAHAHAH HAAAAH HAAAHAHAHA! IT'SSSS FUNNY- IT'SSSS FUNNY BECAUSSSSE HE HASSSS NO-"
Jerry suddenly jumps down his chair and grabs Nights, hoisting him off the ground and shaking him. "DON'T YOU DARE SPEAK ABOUT MY UNCLE IN THAT MANNER YOU WORTHLESS, DISGUSTING, DRUNK, SLIMEY WASTE OF SPACE! YOU ARE THE REASON THE REST OF THE GALAXY SEES THE SLUG SPECIES AS NOTHING BUT A WORTHLESS PILE OF DEGENERATE ROT!" Jerry throws Nights down, making him roll across the floor in a stunned haze. The room has gone completely silent, with everyone else in utter shock. Jerry says nothing, not even an apology, and leaves the room.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_TUCO_1
event.text:
You try to take a brief snooze to ease your mind but are promptly awoken by angry shouts from another room. You follow the sounds into the break room, where it seems Tuco and Jerry are sitting across from each other playing some kind of gambling game with a deck of cards.
"Oh, Captain! Would you like to join us? Tuco is teaching me how to play his favorite game, 'Boarden'. I'm not quite sure I get it, but it's a lot of fun!"
Tuco slams his fist on the table, sending a couple colorful tokens that have been placed around flying. "Don't GET IT? Bloody hell, kid, you're the best god damn gambler I've ever seen. I've gone against the greatest Boarden players in the galaxy and you're whooping my ass. I'm not even going easy!"
Jerry blushes. "Oh... sorry. I'm not trying to make you look bad..." Tuco laughs.
"Don't worry about it kid. Just uh... never go gambling in public. There's a lot of people out there who don't like to lose, and you'll probably end up dead sooner or later. But if you ever DO wanna go... just invite me, alright? I wanna see those sons of bitches get their due."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_JERRY_IRWIN_1
event.text:
Irwin notices Jerry painting an Equinoid mural on one of the ship's walls. Taking interest, he slithers by and observes it. "Ssssay, kid, you got a talent for that. Where'd you learn how to draw ssso well?"
Jerry smiles, "Oh, my uncle used to take me hunting in Guild space. I had a sketchbook back then which I would draw the Equinoids and other wildlife in."
Irwin nods enthusiastically. "OH, you're that one kid who'sss rich uncle forked an arm and a leg over to ussse our hunting groundsss! Alwaysss good to sssee a fellow hunter! Ever tried Equinoid meat? They tassste... ssparkly? I made a soup bowl out of an Equinoid skull once. Lot of remarkable thingsss you can do with a ssskeleton. Oh, and rugsss. Wonderful rugsss, their hidesss make. A good hunter utilizesss every part of their kill!"
Jerry frowns, upset. "Oh I... I never... uhm... I never killed the Equinoids. My uncle did. I just drew them, watched them graze, you know... uh... not much of a hunter."
Irwin realizes his mistake and seems genuinely sorry. "Oh, my bad. Sssorry kid, it'sss jussst sssecond nature to me. Probably for the bessst you're nothing like your uncle."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_NOTHING
event.text: Ellie appears to be sleeping standing up in her quarters. However, when you take a step closer, she draws a knife and points it at you. "Oh, sorry! Ellie didn't see you there! You shouldn't bother a horse when she's sleeping! Go find someone else to play with!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_GENERIC_1
event.text:
"Doo da doo, do do doo doo dadodoo do! Bah doo do do, doo do da doo da! Elllliiieeee, the Equiiiiinoiiiiid!" Ellie snaps her fingers and spins around on one foot, bobbing up and down to the off-beat rhythm of the Ellie theme song. You try to talk to her but she cuts you off, screaming "DO NOT INTERRUPT THE THEME SONG!"
You think you shouldn't interrupt the theme song.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_GENERIC_2
event.text: "I miss my friends! Dora, Cammie, Remmy... We used to have so much fun together! Solving mysteries aboard the Equinox, roaming the galaxy, drinking quarp juice... mmmm... quarp juice! So tasty and delicious!"
"Only the most wonderfulific deliciousfulness in the whole galaxy! It's made from freshly squeezed Quarp! And many many many many additive sugars! Yay!!!"
"It's a fruit, idiot."

choice.text: I don't think Quarp is real.

event.text: Ellie laughs. "Wow superfan, you really are dumb." Ellie says nothing more and gallops away.

choice.text: Offer Ellie some Quarp Juice from storage.

event.text: Ellie nods her head eagerly and takes one of the juice boxes, but as she starts to drink it she spits the pink liquid out. "EWWWW! GROSS! This isn't what quarp juice tastes like! And there's a spider on the box! Stupid stupid buffoons, children don't like spiders! Spiders are gross and icky and scary! Children love horsies! Like me! Neigh!"

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_GENERIC_3
event.text: You make the mistake of accidentally calling Ellie 'Stephan' once, and she reacts rather oddly. She turns to look at you in response for a brief moment before catching her error, immediately spinning back around and pretending she didn't hear you. When you try to get her attention by the name 'Ellie' again, she still doesn't respond. It seems she's fallen into some strange trance, or maybe is pretending to be asleep. You'll have to be more careful next time.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_GENERIC_4
event.text: "It's a shame you're so old superfan! You look just about the age to not quite have been born in time to witness my show! You have no idea about the wonderificness you missed! Not that you COULDN'T have watched it while you were older, silly! It's soooo good it spans generations! Ellie is eternal! Ellie is forever."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_GENERIC_5
event.text: Ellie suddenly leaps towards you and grabs you in a gigantic bear hug, squeezing you so hard you feel like your organs might rupture. "I LOVE hugs! Yay!!! Hugs!! A long time ago there was someone else I used to hug a lot! I don't... I don't remember her name. So strange. But I remember the hugs!" There seems to be a strange sadness in Ellie's voice, but it quickly dissipates as her scattered psyche loses focus and proceeds to the next random adventure.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ELLIE_JERRY_1
event.text:
You notice Jerry watching Ellie strangely. Ellie wanders over to him, offering him an imaginary lollipop. Jerry accepts out of courtesy and follows it with a question. "Hey uh... Ellie? Have we ever met before?"
Ellie cocks her head. "Probably! All the children have watched my show before! Everyone knows Ellie, everyone loves Ellie! You must be another fan!!!"
Jerry nods. "Well yeah, I know you're Ellie. The real Ellie. By the way I'm uh... honored to meet you. I loved your show when I was younger. My favorite show, actually! But I just... I swear we've met. Like, personally. You seem... so familiar, and I don't know why."
Ellie says nothing, seemingly not even hearing the question. Instead she hops away to offer candy hallucinations to someone else. Jerry hangs his head and sighs, then returns to his quarters.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_NOTHING
event.text: Stephan is sitting in his quarters, staring at the battered mask of his old costume. Tears running down his face, he doesn't realize you're watching him until you clear your throat. "S-sorry I can't... I can't talk- talk right now." Looks like you'll have to search elsewhere for conversation.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_GENERIC_1
event.text: "I've been an actor since the day I flunked out of university. I started running a side gig at a traveling carnival as a mascot, where I befriended one of the carnies. That was Paul. We never saw eye to eye on a lot of things. Politics, especially. But we did both have higher hopes for ourselves and our futures than just some carnival shitshow. He had dreams of making his own TV show, and when I told him I had always wanted to be an actor - we had a crazy idea. We pooled our money, and we started recording after work in the big tent. I'd wear my costume and we'd do some basic family friendly comedy. It was a strange time. The Federation was still relatively new, and the Union was still recovering from the Fed-Mantis War. Things looked good for a while, after the Federation managed to put an end to the Inquisitions. People wanted light, fluffy entertainment. Something to just laugh at and forget about that dreadful war. We never expected to find such success... But we blew up! We got a small segment at the end of some big front runner cartoons on a major Union network, and soon started up the Ellie the Equinoid show for real! Things were so hopeful back then... god... and now it's all come to this." Stephan burries his face in his hands, signalling his story is over.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_GENERIC_2
event.text: "I'm a bit ashamed I didn't fight in the Federation-Mantis War. I'm a bit too junior, but not by much. Regardless, I've been a supporter of the Federation since day one. Or I suppose, more accurate, I've been anti-anything that's against the Federation. The Rebellion is a scourge on the Union, the brainchild of people who really, truly think a galaxy where every species is isolated from eachother is a good one. That it's the only way to maintain peace, somehow. Wentworth is an idiot, not a mastermind. He's not really the one who turned the Rebellion into a death machine. It was his corporate interest friends, always whispering in his ear during nights of secret society poker games, that led us here. Frankly, the thing that ruined the Union wasn't even remotely the immigrants, it was the xenophobic masses who wanted rid of them so badly they were willing to tear the whole damn nation apart." Stephan shakes his head in disgust.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_GENERIC_3
event.text:
"I wonder what happened to Elena... it's been so so long. Do you think she knows? About me, and Ellie? When she left me, it wasn't this bad. It wasn't mania, it was just obsession. To think, if I had just gotten my act together..."
Stephan lingers, tears forming in his eyes. "No... I can't... I can't keep dwelling on this. I'm going to tear myself apart if I keep this up. I need to forget Elena. I need to forget the Wentworths, and my old life. I need to be a new Stephan. No longer a circus freak, no longer Ellie. Thank you, Captain, for showing me this light."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_GENERIC_4
event.text: "Captain, do you fear death?" Stephan stares at you blankly, and his deadpan delivery almost makes you wonder if it's meant to be a joke.

Stephan nods. "Then we're in the same boat. This dread, this fear of existence... sometimes it makes me miss the numbness of being Ellie. I didn't know fear, or death, or dread. But is that worth becoming a monster? I guess not. Nothing is. I find so often we try to escape ourselves, escape our mortality, that we let ourselves become something we're not. We become the worst we can be, because when we're our worst, when we hate everyone else and see everyone as an enemy, then death seems like the least of our worries. Now, there is nothing left for me to fear but death. I've lost everything, and yet I still cling to my life. God, I'm such a mess..."

"Interesting. Then I suppose I am jealous of your bravado." Stephan smiles weakly. "In a sense, I almost miss the numbness of being Ellie. I didn't know fear, or death, or dread. But is that worth becoming a monster? I guess not. Nothing is. I find so often we try to escape ourselves, escape our mortality, that we let ourselves become something we're not. We become the worst we can be, because when we're our worst, when we hate everyone else and see everyone as an enemy, then death seems like the least of our worries. Now, there is nothing left for me to fear but death. I've lost everything, and yet I still cling to my life. God, I'm such a mess..."

"I'm afraid I'm not that philosophical, Captain." Stephan laughs. "If you haven't noticed, I used to play a horse in a show for 11 year olds. I'm not exactly a brainiac. If you're asking those kinds of questions though, then keep at it. We need more people who think critically about this existence, and don't rush headfirst into the fray..."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_GENERIC_5
event.text:
"When the Ellie show was still new, and just a little circus sideshow Paul and I ran, one of our biggest struggles was naming the character. That was, until I met a lovely young lady. Her name was Elena, and she became the center of my world. When we started dating, I started calling her by a new nickname. Ellie. Pretty little Ellie lingered in my thoughts every day, every moment of my life. It sat there, brewing, just long enough that one day it just... came to me. 'Ellie the Equinoid'! I just... shouted it. Heh. Paul was startled by the outburst, but it didn't take any convincing. It was a perfect name, and it stuck. The executives we were trying to pitch the show to loved it as well, but most important Elena thought it was fantastic. And so, Ellie came to be."
Stephan looks at the floor. "And now, the name Ellie carries not just one but two sorrows for me. A reminder not only of my disastrous career and descent into madness, but the love of my life I couldn't keep."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_STEPHAN_JERRY_1
event.text:
Jerry cautiously approaches Stephan, taking a seat next to him. "So uh... you're the actor who plays Ellie?" Stephan nods. "Who PLAYED Ellie. That gig is up. I don't... I shouldn't ever go back. Nor could I, with this... mess. And uh, who are you?"
Jerry seems almost disappointed the man doesn't know him. "Oh, I'm Jerry." Stephan nods. "Jerry. Right, good name. Well, to what do I owe the pleasure, Jerry?"
Jerry shrugs. "It's just... have we ever met? In the costume you felt familiar, but without the costume you feel even more familiar. I just don't know from where, is all."
Stephan sighs. "I'm sorry, kid. I've met so many people, so many fans, I just can't remember them all. Maybe when you were younger you attended a tour or something? If your parents used to ta-"
Jerry cuts him off. "Oh, no. I never really knew my parents. My mother died when I was young and I never met my father. My uncle raised me for most of my life."

Stephan leans back and gives a courteous smile. "Well, your uncle must have been a good man then, because you seem like a nice kid."
Jerry shakes his head. "Well... not a lot of people think he's a 'good man' around here. My uncle is uhm... Vance Wentworth."
Stephan stops cold, his pupils retracting. "You... your uncle is who? I'm sorry I think I... I misheard you." Jerry repeats himself. Stephan wavers. "Your... your uncle is... Wentworth? Like... No... no no no... Oh my god..."
Jerry looks at the terrified man, afraid he might be on the verge of another breakdown. "Stephan, are you okay? What's wrong? Do I need to get you to the medical room?!"
Stephan steadies himself, trying to pretend like everything is fine. "It's nothing... it's nothing. Don't worry about it kid." Stephan forces a smile. "I'm sorry for worrying you, that's all. Wentworth for an uncle or not, you seem to have turned out alright. Probably better than however your father could have raised you, yeah?" Stephan chokes back some tears. "I-I'm sorry about your mother. And your father. And everything... Oh god Jerry I'm so sorry..." Stephan can't hold it back any longer, and breaks down sobbing. Jerry, still utterly confused, holds the man in his arms and consoles him. The tragic irony of the situation will, perhaps, forever be lost on him. But maybe it's for the best he never learns who his father really is.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_NOTHING
event.text: Turzil appears to be in sleep mode, though a sticky-note has been stuck lazily to his forehead. Underneath barely legible scribbles it says "DO NOT DISTURB". Assuming you can take a hint, you probably shouldn't bother him.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_GENERIC_1
event.text: You find Turzil's room full of half-painted canvases of beautiful scenery. The Engi spots you looking at them and pushes you out of the room and shuts the door. Seems Turzil still struggles with expression even after separating from the Harmony.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_GENERIC_2
event.text: You find Turzil walking around the ship missing his left arm. "My arm is -currently- behaving poorly. Until it accepts its proper [function] as an arm, it will remain in timeout."

"I fail to understand your [query]. Are you asking the normalcy of arm malfunctions? If so, they are not... -uncommon-, at least amongst malfunctioning Engi. As the Harmony connection erodes, so does the sense of uniformity. Individual components become rogue minds, the body is segmented. Few Separatists retain -existence- as one entity for long. I have [held] on longer than most, but my time will come as well."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_GENERIC_3
event.text: You find Turzil banging himself against the wall repeatedly. You try to help him, but he stops you. "Do not [worry]. I am simply -applying- percussive maintenance. I was [informed] it is effective by Human engineers. Do not temper with my [maintenance] procedures, if you would."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_GENERIC_4
event.text: Turzil approaches you, bearing a question he seems uncomfortable asking. "I carry a request for insight into the concept of emotions. The Harmony simulation dampens the experiences of -stimulation- in the mind, and once free it can be [hard] to adjust. Are emotions made to be painful? Is the experience of sorrow meant to create inescapable misery? Is pain supposed to cause an inescapable sense of discomfort?"

choice.text: That's kind of the point of emotion.

event.text: "Is it? I... I [cannot] comprehend this. Why would life be designed to know such miseries? Why were the Engi -built- to experience them either? I miss being incapable of emoting. I miss not being able to miss things. Although... I do not [miss] the Harmony. This is an unfortunate yet irreconcilable paradox. I hate being a machine."

choice.text: You'll probably get over it soon.

event.text: "That is fortunate to hear. I am still attempting to [gain] control over my rebellious components and re-unify. Perhaps my -cerebral- components are malfunctioning as well. I will have to make adjustments."

choice.text: I am an empty husk devoid of all feeling.

event.text: Turzil stares blankly at you, unsure how to interpret your response. "Is this... meant to be a -joke-? I apologize. I will seek [counsel] elsewhere."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_GENERIC_5
event.text: Turzil approaches meagerly, holding a canvas in his hands. "Captain, I -seek- critical input. As the one -appointed- leader of this crew it is only safe to assume your guidance must be sought on all [crucial] matters. I desire critique. I have engaged in: art." Turzil flips the canvas around to show you a portrait of Admiral Tully of the Federation, painted with broad strokes in a sort of surrealist manner with a heavy use of orange and yellow.

"Unexpected response. Your use of 'great' is [confusing] in ways I do not understand. Is this the elusive irony? I understand in some subcultures -compliments- are meant to be derived as insults. I will, however, opt to give you the benefit of the doubt. I will keep my art in hopes it will... inspire more pleasant emotions."

"I detect strategic [deployment] of vagueness. I will choose to interpret this as a polite negative response. Thank you for your feedback. I must further -hone- my abilities. I will discard this failed attempt."
"Expected response. I will waste no further time in discarding my frivolous doodles. I apologize for the [interruption], Captain."

choice.text: Why don't you show this to Tully?

event.text: Turzil immediately pulls back the paper in shock. "NO!" A light blinks near Turzil's monitor to signal a soft reboot, and he regains his composure. "No, that will not be necessary. I sought only direct input from the [captain]. I will -stash- my foolish scribbling and perhaps seek better ventures with my time."

event.name: SOCIALIZE_TURZIL_GENERIC_6
event.text:
"Pertinent -query-. How does one pronounce the word [INVALID ENTRY]?" Turzil's screen blinks and sparks fly out of him. "Error, failure to pronounce [INVALID ENTRY]."
Again, Turzil's screen blinks and he sparks more. This repeats several times and you start to get worried he'll hurt himself, so you encourage him to stop.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_NOTHING
event.text: Anurak has quarantined himself in his quarters, claiming he has entered mandatory meditation time. Judging from his movements earlier you suspect he may have food poisoning from a bad batch of soup, but either way you shouldn't bother him.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANURAK_GENERIC_1
event.text: "Shellskenbry, I have a very important question for you! Well actually maybe it's not that important but uh it is a question and it's a question for you! Uhm... does your underwear ever mysteriously vanish?"

"Ever since I started hiding in the Ministry Capital, my underwear has been randomly vanishing! I think I may be cursed! Oh this isn't the first curse I've had... I hate curses! A blight on my life, just like all my missing underwear! If you see a nice pair of bright blue briefs do let me know!"
